channel.title: Atsuya Watanabe's Personal Web-site
channel.description: Recent content on Atsuya Watanabe's Personal Web-site

item.description: Oral presentation at 2022 JIM Fall Meeting I presented at the session, “Materials Science and Technology in High-Entropy Alloys (VIII)” in 2022 Japan Institute of Metals and Materials Fall Meeting. Deformation behavior of nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloys at room temperature Atsuya Watanabe, Takahisa Yamamoto, Nozomi Ueyama, Yorinobu Takigawa. 2022 Japan Institute of Metals and Materials Fall Meeting, Materials Science and Technology in High-Entropy Alloys (VIII), S1.20，Fukuoka．

Annual Meeting on Photochemistry 2022 Research findings of collaborative research have been presented in Annual Meeting on Photochemistry 2022. Laser ablation synthesis of FeCoNi medium entropy alloy colloidal solution by using high-repetition rate UV picosecond laser Tomoyuki Yatsuhashi, Atsuya Watanabe． Annual Meeting on Photochemistry 2022 ,1P26, Kyoto.

New paper has been published on SciRep Tensile strength of nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy fabricated using electrodeposition A. Watanabe, T. Yamamoto, and Y. Takigawa Scientific Reports, 12, 12076 (2022). doi: 10.1038/s41598-022-16086-6 Tensile strength of nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy fabricated using electrodeposition

Receiving a fellowship I adopted as a student for “Fellowship Program to Foster International Ph.D.-Holding Researchers through Materials Innovations” by Japan Science and Technology Agency (Grant Number JPMJFS2138)

Graduated from a master’s course and Entering a doctoral course. I graduated from a master’s course at Department of Materials Science, Graduate School of Osaka Prefecture University. And I entered a doctoral course at Department of Materials Science, Graduate School of Engineering, Osaka Metropolitan University I continue a participant in Graduate Course for System-Inspired Leaders in Multidisciplinary Science (SiMS).

I took an oral presentation at the spring meeting of the Japan Inst. Metals and Materials. A. Watanabe, T. Yamamoto, R. Miyamoto, Y. Takigawa. Electrodeposition of bcc FeCoNi medium entropy alloy with fine grains The spring meeting of the Japan Inst. Metals and Materials Materials Science and Technology in High-Entropy Alloys VII, S2.26, on-line.

item.title: Introduction movie for our laboratory on YouTube
item.description: A laboratory I am belonging has been introduced on a YouTube channel of Osaka Metropolitan University. (in Japanese only…)

A paper has been published as a first paper on RSURFI Reducing sulfur to improve thermal embrittlement in electrodeposited nickel using citric acid A. Watanabe, Y. Takigawa Results in Surfaces and Interfaces, 1, 1000001 (2020).（査読有り） doi: 10.1016/j.rsurfi.2020.100001 This paper was selected as a Highlighted Article and featured on the journal page. Reducing sulfur to improve thermal embrittlement in electrodeposited nickel using citric acid

A paper was published on Sci. Rep. Microstructural heterogeneity in the electrodeposited Ni: insights from growth modes I. Matsui, A. Watanabe, Y. Takigawa, N. Omura, T. Yamamoto Sci. Rep., 10, 5548 (2020). doi: 10.1038/s41598-020-62565-z Microstructural heterogeneity in the electrodeposited Ni: insights from growth modes

A paper was published on MTLA Mechanical properties and microstructures after abnormal grain growth in electrodeposited Ni–W alloys I. Matsui, A. Watanabe, T. Uesugi, N. Omura, Y. Takigawa , T. Yamamoto Materialia, 8, 100481 (2019). doi: 10.1016/j.mtla.2019.100481 Mechanical properties and microstructures after abnormal grain growth in electrodeposited Ni–W alloys
